choices.A: From the SharePoint admin center, edit the External sharing settings for the associated site.
choices.B: From the Microsoft Entra admin center, configure the External collaboration settings for guest users.
choices.E: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, set Allow guest access in Teams to Off.
choices.C: From the Microsoft Entra admin center, create a Conditional Access policy.
choices.D: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, set external access to Block all external domains.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct

The correct answer is A. From the SharePoint admin center, edit the External sharing settings for the associated site.Why: Targeted control: It allows you to restrict access specifically for Team1's files without globally affecting external collaboration in other teams.
SharePoint-level control: Files in Teams are stored in SharePoint sites, so managing sharing at the SharePoint level provides granular control over file permissions.

questions.question_text:
Your company uses Teams.

You have a team named Team1.

You need to prevent guest users from accessing files in Team1. The solution must NOT affect external collaboration with any other teams.

What should you do?

comments.content: Completely agree. A is not correct.

discussion.content: B (no) is correct. From the MS Teams Admin center, you modify the Users > Guest access settings, where you can toggle Video conferencing, select Screen sharing options, and toggle Meet now in channels. This is not available in External access settings.

Selected Answer: B
It is No,
It is No, the same as : T2Q8, The correct solutions are in T1Q2 andT2Q53.

Selected Answer: B
B is the correct answer
B is not correct because that setting is not even in Entra

Selected Answer: B
Guest access settings => Meeting => video conferencing

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.

After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.

Your company has a Microsoft 365 subscription that uses an Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) tenant named contoso.com.

You need to prevent guest users in the tenant from using cameras during Microsoft Teams meetings.

Solution: From Microsoft Teams admin center, you modify the External access settings.

Does this meet the goal?

questions.question_text:
Your company uses Teams.

All users are assigned a Microsoft 365 E3 license.

You need to recommend a license that will enable the use of information barriers (IBs) in Teams.

What are two licenses that you can recommend? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
Ans DE
https://aka.ms/M365EnterprisePlans 
(official link for all microsoft license as of 4March,2025)

Selected Answer: DE
Microsoft 365 E5: This comprehensive suite includes IBs as a core feature, removing the need for additional add-ons.
Microsoft 365 E5 Compliance add-on: If you already have Microsoft 365 E3 licenses, this add-on specifically provides IBs functionality without upgrading to the full E5 suite.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that uses Microsoft Teams.

You need to prevent users from creating private channels.

What should you do?

comments.content: Use policies to control which users in your organization are allowed to create private channels. Once you've set the policies, team owners can turn off or turn on the ability for members to create private channels in the Settings tab for a team.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
andwer is D, teams policy -> create private channels

Selected Answer: D
D is the right answer
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-US/microsoftteams/teams-policies#channel-policies

Selected Answer: D
I am sure you don't want to edit the settings for every user seperataly.

Selected Answer: D
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-US/microsoftteams/teams-policies#channel-policies

Selected Answer: A
A seems to be right : Team Level: Team Owners can disable Private Channel creation for their particular Team by clicking on the three dots next to the team name, then clicking on Manage team, then on Settings Tab, expanding Member permissions and unchecking the box next to Allow members to create private channels 1.
Teams Admin Level: Under Teams, click Teams policies. Click on the Global (Org-wide default) policy. Uncheck (switch the toggle to off) next to Create private channels or Create shared channels and click Apply. This will remove the ability for anyone (Team Owners or Team Members) to create Private and Shared channels within Teams

Selected Answer: D
Teams policy: This provides direct control over Teams features and functionalities within your organization. With a Teams policy, you can specifically disable the "Allow team members to create private channels" option, effectively preventing users from creating them.

Selected Answer: D
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-US/microsoftteams/teams-policies#channel-policies

Selected Answer: D
it's D

choices.C: Apply the policy to the sales department users.
choices.A: In the global meeting policy, set Automatically admit users to Everyone.
choices.B: Create a new meeting policy and set Automatically admit users to Everyone.
choices.D: In the global meeting policy, set Automatically admit users to People in your organization.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
B and C are the correct answers as you have to create a new policy and apply the new policy to users in the sales department

Selected Answer: BC
only applying to the sales team while maintaining appropriate security and control for other departments within your organization.

You need to ensure that when the sales department users invite guest users to meetings, the guest users are admitted by default. The solution must only apply to the sales department users.
